results.firPara: • Liverpools first black player says ancestors would turn in graves
results.secPara: • Liverpools first black player says ancestors would turn in graves
results.webTitle: Howard Gayle turns down MBE because it would be ‘betrayal of Africans’

results.firPara: Has there ever been a worse-prepared Premier League side than promoted Hull City? Almost a month after Steve Bruce walked out in despair they still lack a permanent manager and will be under the caretaker stewardship of Mike Phelan when Leicester City visit the KC Stadium on Saturday.
results.secPara: The failure to make a single signing this summer has been exacerbated by an injury crisis and the sale of Mohamed Diamé, an influential midfielder and arguably Hulls best player, to the Championship side Newcastle United.
results.webTitle: Have Hull City suffered the worst-ever Premier League pre-season? | Louise Taylor

results.firPara: Mauricio Pochettino said he attempted to persuade Paul Mitchell to stay at Tottenham Hotspur and that the decision of the clubs head of recruitment to quit has left him very disappointed.
results.secPara: Mitchell tendered his resignation on Tuesday, having had enough of the constraints of his job. Pochettino mentioned personal things that happened but he made it clear he did not want Mitchell to leave. He has a close relationship with him, that dates to their time together at their previous club, Southampton.
results.webTitle: Mauricio Pochettino ‘very disappointed’ by recruitment chief’s exit at Spurs

results.firPara: Guardian writers predicted position 18th (NB this is not necessarily Simon Burntons prediction but the average of our writers tips)
results.webTitle: Premier League 2016-17 preview No18: Watford | Simon Burnton

results.firPara: Swansea City have completed the signing of the Atlético Madrid striker Borja Bastón for a club record fee of £15.5m, subject to international clearance.
results.secPara: The 23-year-old will replace the Ghana international André Ayew, who joined West Ham United for £20.5m on Monday. Swanseas previous record outlay was £12m for Wilfried Bony from Vitesse Arnhem in 2013.
results.webTitle: Swansea City complete £15.5m deal for Atlético Madrid striker Borja Bastón

results.firPara: Arsenal have agreed terms with Valencias Germany defender Shkodran Mustafi, according to the players agent.
results.secPara: Ali Bulut told the German website Spox that a deal for the 24-year-old had been agreed in principle. It now just remains for the teams to come to an agreement over the fee, he said.
results.webTitle: Arsenal agree terms with Valencia defender Shkodran Mustafi, says agent

results.firPara: Slaven Bilic has confirmed the signing of the striker Jonathan Calleri on a season-long loan from Uruguayan side Deportivo Maldonado.
results.secPara: The 22-year-old, who made his name at Boca Juniors and spent the past six months on loan at the Brazilian club São Paulo, was in the Argentina squad who were eliminated from the Olympic Games in Rio after being held to a 1-1 draw by Honduras.
results.webTitle: West Ham confirm loan signing of Argentinian striker Jonathan Calleri

results.firPara: Villarreal are facing a chaotic start to the season after their coach, Marcelino, and his staff left the club just days before their Champions League play-off first-leg home match against Monaco.
results.secPara: Club officials did not give a reason for the coaching staff departing but said they hope to announce an interim or permanent coach in the coming hours.
results.webTitle: Villarreal coach Marcelino departs days before Champions League play-off

results.firPara: The champions had a remarkable 2015-16 campaign but opponents will be wise to them now and there were some concerning signs in their Community Shield defeat against Manchester United
results.secPara: In 1962, Ipswich Town won the league in their first season at the highest level. It was a remarkable achievement and they remain one of the three most surprising English champions since the second world war. In August 1962 they met the FA Cup winners Tottenham Hotspur in the Charity Shield, a game played at Portman Road, and lost 5-1. It was the beginning of a long deflation. Ipswich finished the season 17th, by which point their manager Alf Ramsey had departed to take charge of England.
results.webTitle: Leicester City’s perfect Premier League storm to blow out after freak season | Jonathan Wilson

results.firPara: Sunderland have completed the signings of Manchester United pair Paddy McNair and Donald Love for a combined fee of £5.5m.
results.secPara: David Moyes, Sunderlands new manager, knows the 21-year-olds from his Old Trafford days and believes they can help address problem positions in the squad he inherited from Sam Allardyce.
results.webTitle: Sunderland sign Manchester United pair Paddy McNair and Donald Love
